thread.title: Film screening at Radstock's Victoria Hall
thread.title_full: Film screening at Radstock's Victoria Hall

author: Somerset Guardian
title: Film screening at Radstock's Victoria Hall
text:
Film screening at Radstock's Victoria Hall By Somerset Guardian | Posted: October 08, 2015 Film screening at Radstock's Victoria Hall X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Bath Film Festival's autumn cinema season at the Victoria Hall continues on Saturday, October 10 with the family animation Home (PG) at 4.30pm and the British drama, The Falling (12A) at 7.30pm. 
The Falling is a mesmerising psychological drama exploring a mysterious fainting outbreak in 1969 at a strict English girls' school in 1996. Game of Thrones star Maisie Williams plays intense and trouble Lydia and rising star, Florence Pugh plays her best friend. Director Carol Morley captures the claustrophobic atmosphere of a 1960's all girls' school filled with burgeoning sexuality and fraught friendships. 
"Atmospheric, insightful and darkly funny" The Times. 
Home is an adorable animated sci-fi comedy by Dreamworks Animation. When Oh, a loveable misfit from another planet, lands on Earth and finds himself on the run from his own people, he forms an unlikely friendship with an adventurous girl named Tip who is on a quest of her own. Through a series of comic adventures with Tip, Oh comes to understand that being different and making friends is all part of being human. And while he changes her planet and she changes her work, they discover the true meaning of the word HOME. 
Tickets for all the screenings are £5/£3 and can be booked online through the Victoria Hall website www.victoriahallradstock.co.uk or by telephoning Bath Box Office on 01225 463362.
